properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 7 at 4:00AM EST until January 8 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Marquette MI
properties.description:
* WHAT...Lake effect snow and areas of blowing snow will develop
later this afternoon and continue into Wednesday afternoon. The
heaviest snow will occur tonight. Expect total snow
accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. Northwest winds will gust to 25
to 35 mph, strongest in open areas along Lake Superior.

* WHERE...Alger, Luce and Northern Schoolcraft Counties.

* WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 4 PM EST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could become very difficult at times. Falling
snow combined with blowing snow will result in periods of
significantly reduced visibility and drifted snow on roads. The
hazardous conditions may impact the evening commute today and
will impact the morning commute on Wednesday.
properties.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 PM EST WEDNESDAY
